questions.question: Identify the best answer for the following sign
answer_choices: Stop only if other vehicles are approching

questions.question: When should you use your vehicle's headlights?
answer_choices: When visibility is reduced and you can't see 150 meters ahead

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection with a yield sign. What should you do?
answer_choices: Stop and wait for the light to turn green
Slow down and proceed without stopping
Stop and wait for a gap in traffic before entering the intersection
Speed up and cross the intersection quickly

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit in a residential area in Ontario, unless posted otherwise?
What is the legal blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit for drivers under the age of 22 in Ontario?
When is it legal to pass another vehicle on the right in Ontario?
answer_choices: When the vehicle ahead is making a left turn and there's room to pass safely

questions.question: What is the correct hand signal for indicating a left turn?
answer_choices: Extend your left arm straight out of the window
Extend your right arm straight out of the window
Extend your left arm upward with the elbow bent
Extend your left arm downward with the palm facing behind you

questions.question: When should you use your four-way flashers (hazard lights)?
answer_choices: When your vehicle is stopped in an emergency or breakdown situation
Whenever you want to alert other drivers that you're in a hurry
When you want to park on the side of the road

questions.question: What should you do when you see a school bus with its red lights flashing and its stop arm extended?
answer_choices: Stop at least 20 meters behind the bus and wait until the lights stop flashing
Slow down and proceed with caution
Pass the bus if there are no children near it
Ignore the bus and continue driving

questions.question: In which of the following situations are you allowed to make a U-turn?
answer_choices: At any intersection with a traffic light
On a curve where visibility is limited
In a school zone during school hours
Where a 'No U-turn' sign is posted

questions.question: When is it mandatory to wear seat belts in a motor vehicle?
answer_choices: Only if you're sitting in the front seat
At all times while the vehicle is in motion, for all occupants
Only if you're on a highway

questions.question: What is the minimum following distance you should maintain behind the vehicle in front of you on a highway?
answer_choices: As close as you can without touching the vehicle in front

questions.question: You approach an intersection with a green traffic light, but there are pedestrians in the crosswalk. What should you do?
answer_choices: Honk your horn to alert the pedestrians
Yield the right-of-way to the pedestrians
Speed up to clear the intersection quickly

questions.question: What does a solid yellow line in the center of the road indicate?
answer_choices: You can pass other vehicles if it's safe to do so
No passing allowed in either direction
Passing is allowed in one direction only
You must drive in the opposite lane

questions.question: If you're involved in a collision where someone is injured or killed, what must you do?
answer_choices: Exchange insurance information and leave the scene
Move the injured person to a safer location
Immediately report the collision to the police
Leave the scene to avoid getting involved

questions.question: What is the purpose of a crosswalk on the road?
answer_choices: A designated area for pedestrians to rest
A decorative pattern on the road
A marked area for pedestrians to safely cross the road
A lane for bicycles to cross the road

questions.question: What is the legal maximum speed limit on a 400-series highway in Ontario, unless posted otherwise?
When must you signal before making a turn?
answer_choices: At least 3 meters (10 feet) before turning
Only if there are other vehicles around
At the same time as you start the turn

questions.question: In Ontario, what is the minimum age to apply for a G1 driver's license with parental consent?
What should you do when you encounter a yield sign?
answer_choices: Stop completely and wait for all traffic to clear
Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
Always go first, regardless of other traffic

questions.question: What is the legal limit for the number of passengers under the age of 22 in a G2 driver's vehicle between midnight and 5 a.m.?
When driving on a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, which lane is typically used for faster-moving traffic?
answer_choices: Any lane, as it doesn't matter

questions.question: What should you do when you approach a railway crossing with flashing lights and bells activated?
answer_choices: Speed up to clear the crossing quickly
Stop and proceed when safe, only if a train is visible
Continue driving without stopping or looking for a train
Stop and remain behind the white stop line until the lights stop flashing and the bells stop ringing
